title: 1989 FLASHBACK - CABINET PAPERS
snippet:
■ The Berlin Wall falls in 1989 signalling the start of the end of the Cold War. ■ Salman Rushdie controversy: Leader of Iran issues a fatwa calling for the death of Indian-born British author Salman Rushdie for issuing novel The Satanic Verses. On February 12, a 10,000-strong protest took place in Islamabad after Pakistan banned the book in November 1988.

■ First episode of The Simpsons premieres on Fox in the US ■ Hundreds to thousands die in Tiananmen Square protests in China. A protester famously stands in front of a line of tanks blocking their way before he is pulled away by bystanders.■Oil tanker Exxon Valdez crashes off the Alaskan coast, spilling 10.8 million US gallons of crude oil. Its considered to be one of the worst human-made environmental disasters.
